items.title: Senior Build and Release Engineer at Bitnami () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: QA/Test Developer
Industry: Cloud Services, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Loved by Devs, trusted by Ops: Bitnami’s mission is to bring awesome software to everyone. Every month, 1MM+ developers come to our site to download and launch their favorite language runtimes and applications across all major public clouds and container platforms, including AWS, Google, Azure, VMware and Docker.

We’re looking for an experienced Build and Release Engineer. This role will be responsible for reducing build and release times by improving the automation of our current release pipeline and introducing continuous deployment best practices.

You will be joining a team focused on providing the largest catalog of cloud applications and frameworks to developers. Our offerings range from turnkey solutions for components such as multi-node deployment templates for databases, caching or message brokers; to trusted containers to base their applications from such as nodejs,php or python. The perfect person for this role comes from a process-automation background and has extensive experience in the complex art of continuously releasing software.

Responsibilities

    • Reduce build and release times by improving the automation of our current procedures.
    • Stabilize and improve releases of open source software by removing manual intervention and introducing continuous deployment best practices
    • Extend and maintain release metrics to fuel our data-driven improvement process
    • Establish monitoring of our release pipeline, introducing an early warning system
    • Deep-dive and refactor legacy code, as needed
    • Be actively involved and drive team-wide discussions about software best practices
    • Coach and train junior members of the team

Our Ideal Addition to the Team

    • Passionately believes in our mission to bring server applications to everyone
    • Is experienced with releasing a complex catalog of software products to cloud systems
    • Has delivered build, test and release automated pipelines that are fast, efficient and reliable
    • Is a champion for developers, learning their biggest pain points and providing automation tools to remove them
    • Has experience implementing robust integration tests for user interfaces (E.g. Selenium, CasperJS or others)
    • Has proven ability to navigate priorities in a distributed and fast-paced environment
    • Has strong expertise on Agile and code management best practices
    • Has experience with Artifact repositories such as Jfrog, Sonatype Nexus

Requirements

    • Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science preferred
    • At least 4 years of development and deployment experience
    • At least 4 years of creating build and release pipelines for continuous delivery (ideally with Jenkins, Circle CI, Docker and Kubernetes)
    • Excellent verbal and written communication skills (English)

Benefits/Perks

    • Competitive salary and stock options
    • Flexible time off policy; we believe everyone needs to recharge
    • Your choice of machine and hardware
    • Annual trips to Spain (if working remotely)
    • Benefits vary based on location 

** Please do not apply if your timezone does not fall between UTC -2 and UTC +4

About Bitnami

Bitnami is a globally-distributed software company, headquartered in San Francisco with team members in over 10 countries. We are a bootstrapped, profitable, high-growth company with a high-energy and passionate team. 

Learn more about us and what it's like to work at Bitnami by visiting the About Us and Careers pages on our website. 

Bitnami is an equal opportunity employer.

Benefits

Your choice of computer and OS
Mmmm food
Stock options
We have fun
Annual All-Hands and Offsite trip
Opportunities to work remotely
Exciting and innovative work

items.title: Robotics Process Automation Architect(Remote role, US Citizens/GC holders) - Calibro Corp - Remote
items.content:
Robotics Process Automation Architect(Remote role, US Citizens/GC holders)
Calibro Corp -Remote
Contract

Job Summary

There is an urgent Robotics Automation Architect position (Remote role). This will be a Skype interview followed by an offer

Job Description:

POSITION SUMMARY :

Client is looking for a talented thought leader with experience in having delivered Robotic Process Automation (RPA) solutions leveraging industry-leading RPA vendor technologies such as UiPath, BluePrism, and Automation Anywhere. Client is in the process of embarking on its Intelligent Automation (IA) journey and this individual will play a key role in formulating its strategy and execution.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Perform the role of a thought leader and technical lead to help guide the design and implementation of automation solutions using industry-standard RPA solutions.
  • Analyze business processes and identify automation opportunities and assess automation feasibility.
  • Help facilitate sessions with business users to elicit use cases for automation; act as a thought leader in helping prioritize and document them in a formal technical design documents.
  • Develop AS-IS and TO-BE process flows.
  • Design robotic process automation architecture and logic using industry best practices to deliver solutions that are efficient, well-structured, & maintainable.
  • Deliver and demonstrate effective proof-of-concept solutions to demonstrate RPA.
  • Create and maintain solution documentation.
  • Play a key role in helping create an Intelligent Automation Center of Excellence (CoE).
  • Problem-solve issues that arise in day-to-day running of RPA processes and providing timely responses and solutions as required.
  • Contribute to the development of governance, methodologies, and procedures to continually improve a rapid and repeatable delivery channel for Automaton Delivery Team.
  • Create and document test procedures and scenarios for the pre-UAT phases.
  • Support the Operational Teams during the UAT and rollout phases.
  • Participate in the development of robotic operating model (ROM) for long-term maintenance, support, and hand-off to the delivery organization.
  • Identify & assist in initial setting up and support of an RPA development infrastructure to support process automation across the enterprise.
  • Lead hands-on and non-hands-on training sessions in the use of RPA tools and best practices for using RPA tools to deliver robotic solutions.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 3+ years of thought leadership and execution experience in both Business process automation & Robotic process automation
  • 7+ years of strong experience in delivery of end-to-end software projects using cutting-edge technologies
  • Developer certifications in Ui Path, BluePrism, or Automation Anywhere preferred (we have not decided on a particular tool as yet and this person may play a role in its selection)
  • Experience with configuring Optical Character Recognition (OCR) technologies and integrating to RPA and other process automation technologies
  • Experience with leveraging machine learning models and how to train them a plus
  • Experience with some or all of the following programming languages & technologies is preferred :
  • Microsoft Technologies (VB .NET, Windows, Internet Explorer, SQL Server, Web Services)
  • Application integration using Web Services/RESTFUL API access, integration bus (ex: Tibco, Biztalk, etc.)
  • Scripting languages (ex. python, perl, etc.)
  • Programming languages such as Java, C#, HTML, etc.

Job Type: Contract

Required experience:

  • SDLC: 9 years
  • Business process automation: 6 years
  • Big 4 consulting exp.: 2 years
  • Robotics automation: 4 years
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=5, dotnet=33, c=2, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=3, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
